page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: As{most people travel out of the area {to work, school and shop,}transport plays an important part. Two school buses are provided each day and as there is little industry in the area, the majority of people need to travel to work. Different forms of transport are used such as cars, motor cycles and bicycles, with a small number walking.{The only form of public {transport is the bus.}In former years the bus service was more extensive, but with most households owning at least one car, it is only the older inhabitants who rely on public transport nowadays. Consequently, the service has been reduced drastically, until{now buses only run on alternate {days.}The summer brings a lot of visitors to the area, most travel by car, but buses do operate extensively at weekends and holiday times.
